title: Google\Cloud\Run\V2\VersionToPath
name: VersionToPath
description:
VersionToPath maps a specific version of a secret to a relative file to mount to, relative to VolumeMount's mount_path.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.run.v2.VersionToPath

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.path
params.description: Required. The relative path of the secret in the container.

params.name: data.version
params.description: The Cloud Secret Manager secret version. Can be 'latest' for the latest value, or an integer or a secret alias for a specific version.

params.name: data.mode
params.description: Integer octal mode bits to use on this file, must be a value between 01 and 0777 (octal). If 0 or not set, the Volume's default mode will be used. Notes Internally, a umask of 0222 will be applied to any non-zero value. This is an integer representation of the mode bits. So, the octal integer value should look exactly as the chmod numeric notation with a leading zero. Some examples: for chmod 777 (a=rwx), set to 0777 (octal) or 511 (base-10). For chmod 640 (u=rw,g=r), set to 0640 (octal) or 416 (base-10). For chmod 755 (u=rwx,g=rx,o=rx), set to 0755 (octal) or 493 (base-10). * This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

methods.name: getPath
methods.description:
Required. The relative path of the secret in the container.

Generated from protobuf field string path = 1 [(.google.api.field_behavior) = REQUIRED];

methods.name: getMode
methods.description:
Integer octal mode bits to use on this file, must be a value between 01 and 0777 (octal). If 0 or not set, the Volume's default mode will be used.

Notes

  • Internally, a umask of 0222 will be applied to any non-zero value.
  • This is an integer representation of the mode bits. So, the octal integer value should look exactly as the chmod numeric notation with a leading zero. Some examples: for chmod 777 (a=rwx), set to 0777 (octal) or 511 (base-10). For chmod 640 (u=rw,g=r), set to 0640 (octal) or 416 (base-10). For chmod 755 (u=rwx,g=rx,o=rx), set to 0755 (octal) or 493 (base-10).
  • This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

Generated from protobuf field int32 mode = 3;

Notes

  • Internally, a umask of 0222 will be applied to any non-zero value.
  • This is an integer representation of the mode bits. So, the octal integer value should look exactly as the chmod numeric notation with a leading zero. Some examples: for chmod 777 (a=rwx), set to 0777 (octal) or 511 (base-10). For chmod 640 (u=rw,g=r), set to 0640 (octal) or 416 (base-10). For chmod 755 (u=rwx,g=rx,o=rx), set to 0755 (octal) or 493 (base-10).
  • This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.
